website_summaries.verdict: There’s smart and then there’s brilliant. A large WiFi-enabled touch screen on this dazzling fridge makes the kitchen a smart-device epicenter.
pros: Use the touch screen or go hands-free with Bixby to play music, watch TV, make shopping lists, or look inside the fridge with three built-in cameras
FlexZone turns a freezer into a fridge with the touch of a button
cons: The smart features can be costly overkill for some

website_summaries.verdict: The cheapest Family Hub fridge is surprisingly affordable and comes with enough smart features to merit consideration.
pros: Samsung's cheapest Family Hub fridge has all of the same smart features as before, and it offers decent performance for the price
cons: The build feels a little flimsy in places, the touchscreen still feels a little underdeveloped and the temperature-adjustable Cool Select Pantry drawer didn't actually offer much variance from setting to setting
Also, with just 16.2 cubic feet in the fridge, it might not offer enough storage space for larger families

customer_reviews.title: Worst refrigerator I've owned in 50 years
customer_reviews.text: Worst refrigerator I've owned in 50 years. Has to be de-iced every few month. Ice maker Brooke. Developed a water leak. Fan went out. And finally upper cooling unit . I've spent about $600 in repairs plus my own time,
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Horrible appliances horrible service
customer_reviews.text: Heads up: do NOT buy Samsung appliances. Actually the installer warned me they often need repair, but now the poor Samsung repairman has had to come out FIVE times and is now video conferencing with their engineer as they’re making him PROVE what he told them two visits ago, which is that the defective unit needs to be replaced after 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Riley L.

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Makes Low-Quality Refrigerators
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, it seems that all Samsung Refrigerators have a flaw that causes the refrigerator portion to stop cooling about 3-5 years after purchase. At this point the refrigerator is out of warranty, and Samsung support leads you down an infinite rathole of non-solutions. I would avoid this brand until they can demonstrate they can competently make a refrigerator and/or extend their warranty significantly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Still waiting for refund.
customer_reviews.text: Ice maker failed 6 months after purchase. It cannot be repaired. Even though still under Warranty and a refund has been approved, I have not received a check. This, despite many phone calls and emails. This has been going on for months. Will never buy another Samsung product.. Spoiler alert: Samsung doesn't care. (Bought from Home Depot)
customer_reviews.author: Hedgewick

customer_reviews.title: Ice buildup in ice maker, seizing it up!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful Refrigerator thought I'm having to defrost my ice maker every 3 weeks. I have purchased an updated motherboard and ice maker and it still freezes up. Customer service is of no help and if you Google the reviews on it you'll get a lot of disgusted customers with the same problem!
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Company does not have a reliable product.
customer_reviews.text: Nice refrigerator as long as you do not need an ice maker. Ice maker constantly freezes up needing defrosting.
customer_reviews.author: william loeffler

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Biggest piece of crap I ever bought in my life. If you enjoy the constant humming and emptying it every month, to defrost it? This fridge is for you! Update 3-18: After threatening to give these bad reviews on every site I could find, and mentioning the class-action lawsuit filed against them, for this POS. They agreed to send repair guy, at no charge. He is replacing a part on Wed.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan Household

customer_reviews.title: Ice Maker Issues
customer_reviews.text: Total POS!! Ice maker freezes over. No fix in sight. Warranty replaced my ice maker inner components twice and it still iced over. Samsung support won’t accept any responsibility. Dear Samsung, stick to phones! You suck at appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Do your research before purchasing this unit!!!
customer_reviews.text: Save your money the ice machine is a nightmare. It’s ice freezes around the unit that makes the ice...if you are lucky you may be able to pull the tray out. I use my unit for food and water only and purchase bags of ice 3 times a week.
customer_reviews.author: Mntcharles

customer_reviews.title: Buyers Regret
customer_reviews.text: I have had this refrigerator since 2017. I've had an increasing number of ice jams in the ice maker. Finally, I researched how to correct the problem but instead found there is a class-action lawsuit over this very issue. DO NOT BUY ANY SAMSUNG REFRIGERATOR WITH THIS STYLE ICE MAKER. Customer support has been of no help. I'm stuck with a $2300 piece of junk and now have a countertop icemaker as a workaround.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Side by Side Refrigerator won't cool
customer_reviews.text: I didn't actually purchase my refrigerator. The sellers included it with my home purchase and now I know why they didn't want to take it with them. The refrigerator is 6 years old and I've had it for 3 years. The first problem was the ice maker, paid a couple of hundred to replace that and now the refrigerator side won't cool. The temperature began to rise and I tried everything online that the Samsung reps told me to do and it's still at 51 degrees. After reading reviews here and on other sites, at this point I don't want to put any more money into it.
customer_reviews.author: Lett

customer_reviews.title: For a more balanced view see Consumer Reports
customer_reviews.text: CRs Take Overall, this is a very good refrigerator with Excellent thermostat control Very Good temperature uniformity Very Good energy efficiency Excellent at noise Fair icemaking performance Fair crisper performance digital controls on its front door that show actual temperature an external water dispenser dual evaporators a door open alarm a built-in water filter spillproof shelves ice storage in its refrigerator
customer_reviews.author: Frederic

customer_reviews.title: Breaks every 18 months
customer_reviews.text: We have has a Samsung Refrigerator since 2014 and it has been serviced 3 times. A circuit chip needed to be replaced at 18 months and 2 times we have had to defrost the refrigerator due to ice buildup and water dripping below the vegetable drawers. Read the other reviews carefully - Samsung refrigerators have a problem with ice buildup. If I could rate it zero stars I would. A "nice" looking refrigerator is not worth the hassle of constantly defrosting and repairing the refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: Giraffe

customer_reviews.title: low quality product and bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought a band new Samsung refrigerator and it was faulty. So far more than five months have passed. The issue still has not been resolved. Avoid Samsung whenever you can.

customer_reviews.title: DO. NOT. BUY SAMSUNG FRIDGES
customer_reviews.text: DONT BUY SAMSUNG FRIDGES. THEY ALL BREAK DOWN AND FREEZE. WHATEVER YOU SAVE SPENDING LESS ON SAMSUNG YOULL PAY IN REPAIRMAN FEES. ASK ANYONE YOU KNOW WITH A SAMSUNG. I BOUGHT TWO AT THE SAME TIME NOT KNOWING HOW TERRIBLE THEY ARE. SUCH A PAIN. EVERY MONTH I HAVE TO TAKE EVERYTHING OUT AND LET IT DE-ICE. AWFUL They need to stick to TVs and phones. Quit making appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C.

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from Samsung Appliances
customer_reviews.text: the French door style and smart hub features and screen was appealing but we noticed quickly that the quality of the fridge was poor. The shelving plastic trim cracked quickly, the door bins break easily, the Water dispenser shoots at an angle that forces the water to come out of the cups, the labeling of the humidity control bins wiped off with a simple cloth and cleaning spray, and the ice maker is defective and freezes up all of the time. There is a class action lawsuit on this.
customer_reviews.author: Babadook84

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Door Bins Break, and are very expensive to replace
customer_reviews.text: Samsung's warranty on the refrigerator we bought 5 years ago was only for one year. So now, when the plastic door bins get brittle and shatter, we have to pay $75/each or more for replacements. So far, three of them have broken. I spoke with Samsung customer "support" and all they were willing to do was tell me where I could buy replacement parts. EDIT on 10/2/2019: NOW FOUR OF THE BINS HAVE BROKEN. Samsung customer support insists they have no responsibility to make this right.
customer_reviews.author: James B. Hepp

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: My refrigerator, samsung rf263beaeww, has a flaw in the design of the ice dispenser. When it broke the first time, Samsung tried to charge me over $500 for a repair. I spoke to a manager to tell him i knew there was a class action lawsuit for this problem and they wound up not charging me. Three years later I have the same problem. I spoke to someone who put me on hold for AN HOUR with the manager. Then i was told a manager would call back. They never did. Avoid SAMSUNG refrigerators. The unit is otherwise pretty good, but customer service is AWFUL.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Green
